title: can't reconnect / reconnect when ready
author: Rom265
body_snippet:
Sometimes when I try to connect to a server with RDP, it will start to connect, show a black screen and then dump me back out. I can use the context menu > Reconnect option over and over and get the same results with a 4360 error. Then, sometimes, I can click the box that says 'reconnect when ready' and that works. Other times it doesn't and gives error 3334. 

My local machine is Windows 10 Enterprise 1909. I've only had this computer for a couple weeks. I think it has only happened with this...

comments.snippet:
Hi, I think I came across the same issue this week. It helped me to add a new entry for "TERMSRV/*" into
Control Panel\All Control Panel Items\Credential Manager -> Windows Credentials -> Add a generic credential.
Use any fake username and password there.

With this fix in place and with some of our servers I also encountered issue #540. Fixed it by gpedit.msc / enabling "Allow Delegating Saved Credentials with NTLM-only Server Authentication".
comments.author: jbubik
